Package imagingbook.lib.util

Class SerializationHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • imagingbook.lib.util.SerializationHelper
  • public class SerializationHelper
extends java.lang.Object
    Helper class providing simple static methods for writing/reading serialized data to/from files. It is recommended to serialize only data structures composed of standard Java types. Otherwise, if self-defined classes are reloaded, classes of previously serialized objects may not match any more, causing a ClassNotFoundException to be thrown.
    Version:
    2018/04/03

    • Method Detail

      • writeObject

        public static java.lang.String writeObject​(java.lang.Object obj,
                                           java.lang.String fileName)
        Deprecated.
        Writes a serialized representation of an arbitrary Java object to a file. Make sure the serialized object is composed of standard Java types only to avoid class loader problems.
        Parameters:
        obj - The object to be serialized.
        fileName - The file to write to.
        Returns:
        The full path of the written file.

      • writeObject

                                           java.io.File file)
        Writes a serialized representation of an arbitrary Java object to a file.
        Parameters:
        obj - The object to be serialized.
        file - The file to write to.
        Returns:
        The full path of the written file.

      • readObject

        public static java.lang.Object readObject​(java.lang.String fileName)
        Deprecated.
        Reads an object (of known type) from a serialization file. The return value must be cast to the appropriate type, which must be known.
        Parameters:
        fileName - The file containing serialized data.
        Returns:
        The object reconstructed from the file representation or null if unsuccessful.

      • readObject

        public static java.lang.Object readObject​(java.io.File file)
        Reads an object (of known type) from a serialization file. The return value must be cast to the appropriate type, which must be known.
        Parameters:
        file - The file to read.
        Returns:
        The object reconstructed from the file representation or null if unsuccessful.
